name: Carnegie-Mellon Computer Recycling Center (CMU CRC)
hours: Monday: 9:30 AM - 4:30 PM Tuesday: 9:30 AM - 4:30 PM Wednesday: 9:30 AM - 4:30 PM Thursday: 9:30 AM - 4:30 PM Friday: 9:30 AM - 4:30 PM
materials: Computer (Reuse); Computer (Recycling); Computer Monitors; Electronics; Laptop Computers; Computer Peripherals; Printers/Scanners/Fax Machines; Small Televisions; Tablets; Televisions; Video Game Consoles; PlayStation Consoles
notes: Computing Services is located in Cyert Hall, Room A-75.  The Carnegie Mellon Computer Recycling Center (CRC) is a group of volunteers within the Computing Services division at Carnegie Mellon who provide a way for members of the Carnegie Mellon community -- faculty, staff and students -- to dispose of unwanted computer equipment in a socially and environmentally responsible manner. The CRC provides a contact point for university departments and individuals who have computer equipment they no longer need and have questions about how to best dispose of it.
